column4: Ubuntu is an ancient African word with a dual meaning it roughly translates into "Slackware is too hard for me" and "I can't configure Debian"
is a modern-day English word meaning "I troll #ubuntu IRC" and "I'm jealous because my distro takes longer to install than Ubuntu." ;-)
actually Slackware's installer is faster than Ubuntus
that is if one knows what one is doing
